(4 comments)

@riya, 

lets try to write this API using msgbuf APIs
fix the aligning here
Done
u can use the msgbuf API with init here and then use span and extract to get the child entities data.
Done
here too u can use msgbuf
Done
This has commented out code and miscellaneous debug prints, so I won't review it until at least these issues are resolved.

can we trim this?
The commit adds an API that finds the existing container ID of the effecter or sensor from the corresponding Entity Association PDR.
something like this?
Done

nit: container
This is just finding the container ID correct? how will this API update the container ID?
Done
Can we add a CHANGELOG entry for the change?
nit:extra space
Done
do we need a proper error return here rather than assert?
Added by mistake removed the function. Thanks for pointing out.
Please avoid using "This commit" in commit messages - it's implicit, right?
Done
Can you please discuss the motivations and use-cases? The commit message is for explaining "why" and analyzing trade-offs made in the implementation.
Done
Drop this, it seems redundant?
Done
Please drop the `Tested:` line. I find them to be meaningless, and they're largely supplanted by good unit tests.
Done

Hi Riya, thanks for the patch. I've left a number of comments throughout that hopefully help improve things.

Further, as you're changing the public headers of the library, can you please add an entry to the changelog?

Hi Andrew, thanks for your valuable feedback. I have addressed all review comments to best of my knowledge. Please review the re-work patchset. 
Thanks.
What happens on error? Is it impossible for an error to occur?
Done

Please prefix symbols with a short-name for the relevant specification. We're using `pdr` for e.g. the API defined immediately above this. Using that and including `entity` as the relevant subject of the search:

`pldm_pdr_find_entity_container_id()`.
Done

Asserts must not be used for error handling. Please make sure you understand these definitions in the changes checklist:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/docs/checklists/changes.md#definitions

Further, for whatever reason, GCC-14's analyzer doesn't catch this as an instance of a reachable assertion. That's kinda surprising, and I'm a bit suspicious I've missed something in how the CI is set up.
Done

Please don't default-initialise variables unnecessarily, it prevents subsequent bugs from being caught by valgrind or ubsan.

I realise this is not what is preferred for C++, but this is not C++.
Done

`pldm_msgbuf_init_errno()` returns negative errno values, but the declaration of `pldm_find_container_id()` defines the return type as uint16_t. These are not compatible.

Please change the declaration of `pldm_find_container_id()` to return an `int` so it can correctly signal errors.
Done
Just pass `NULL` here and in any other similar calls to `pldm_msgbuf_span_required()`.
Done
You must check the return code here before using the value of `hdr_type`.
Done

Can we negate this condition and use `goto cleanup_buf` after adding a `cleanup_buf:` label above line 525?

That way the following code in the if-body can be unindented one level.
Done
This isn't yet done as of PS19.
Done
You must check the return code here before subsequent use of `num_children`.
Done
You need to check the return value of this.
Done
Is zero not a valid container ID?
Acknowledged

Building this with GCC-14 via `./scripts/pre-submit` I see:

```
[73/75] Compiling C++ object tests/dsp_pdr.p/dsp_pdr.cpp.o
FAILED: tests/dsp_pdr.p/dsp_pdr.cpp.o 
ccache c++ -Itests/dsp_pdr.p -Isrc -I../src -I../subprojects/googletest/googletest/include -I../subprojects/googletest/googletest -Isubprojects/googletest/__CMake_build -I../subprojects/googletest/__CMake_build -Isubprojects/googletest -I../subprojects/googletest -I../subprojects/googletest/googlemock/include -I../subprojects/googletest/googlemock -fdiagnostics-color=always -DNDEBUG -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wextra -Wpedantic -Werror -std=c++23 -O3 -DLIBPLDM_API_DEPRECATED -DLIBPLDM_API_TESTING -pthread -isystem../subprojects/googletest/googletest -isystem../subprojects/googletest/googletest/include -isystem../include -isysteminclude -MD -MQ tests/dsp_pdr.p/dsp_pdr.cpp.o -MF tests/dsp_pdr.p/dsp_pdr.cpp.o.d -o tests/dsp_pdr.p/dsp_pdr.cpp.o -c ../tests/dsp/pdr.cpp
In file included from ../tests/dsp/pdr.cpp:11:
In function ‘int pldm_msgbuf_insert_uint16(pldm_msgbuf*, uint16_t)’,
    inlined from ‘virtual void FindContainerID_testValidInstanceID_Test::TestBody()’ at ../tests/dsp/pdr.cpp:139:30:
../src/msgbuf.h:705:23: error: ‘_buf.pldm_msgbuf::cursor’ may be used uninitialized [-Werror=maybe-uninitialized]
  705 |                 memcpy(ctx->cursor, &val, sizeof(val));
      |                 ~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../tests/dsp/pdr.cpp: In member function ‘virtual void FindContainerID_testValidInstanceID_Test::TestBody()’:
../tests/dsp/pdr.cpp:107:24: note: ‘_buf.pldm_msgbuf::cursor’ was declared here
  107 |     struct pldm_msgbuf _buf;
      |                        ^~~~
cc1plus: all warnings being treated as errors
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```

Given this is C++, it seems to be the case that you need to construct it?

```
struct pldm_msgbuf _buf{};
```

That resolved the error for me.
Done

Once you've finished populating the buffer you must call `pldm_msgbuf_destroy_consumed()` and validate the return value with `ASSERT_EQ()`.

Please make sure you've done this everywhere necessary in this patch.
Done

See proposed solution above.
Done
Hi Riya, thanks for the updates. I've made some comments inline. Some touch on what I think are misunderstandings of intent with the msgbuf APIs, but others are hopefully straight-forward to address.
This isn't right; changes should only be added under the `[Unreleased]` header. Can you please rebase this patch on the tip of `main`?
Done
Can you please change this to `-ENOENT` in line with https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/75825 ?
Done
Done
I've un-resolved the comment on PS16, as my request there hasn't yet been addressed.
Done
This return doesn't make sense if you're unconditionally jumping over it with the `goto` above.
Done

We've already failed the call to `pldm_msgbuf_destroy()` but the jump to `cleanup` will just try to destroy it again before returning. The only thing to do on failure of `pldm_msgbuf_destroy()` is to immediately return the error.
Done
This must be done **before** you use the memory backing the msgbuf. You need to do it on line 142 above, which is roughly where I left the comment on PS16.
Done

Again, you must do this before you use the buffer that underlies the msgbuf instance. This must be done between lines 193 and 195.

Please note you are not "destroying" the underlying buffer, but rather the msgbuf instance itself, which does not own the underlying buffer[^1]. Destroying the msgbuf instance validates that you've not encountered any errors in the process of packing or unpacking data into or from the underlying buffer. It has no other side-effect - specifically, it **does not** e.g. erase or corrupt the data, free the memory, etc of the underlying buffer.

[^1]: If it helps, in rust terms, the msgbuf instance has a mutable borrow of your underlying buffer.
Done

Please use imperative voice here:

```
pdr: Add API for finding container IDs
```

Even better might be mentioning the function by name directly:

```
pdr: Add pldm_pdr_find_entity_container_id()
```
This repeats the subject. I prefer we drop it.
Hi Riya, thanks for the rework, it's looking good. Just a couple of small requests left on the commit message.
Make this match the commit subject once you've chosen one of the suggestions.
